news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Evercloak, a cleantech startup, successfully raised $2 million in an oversubscribed seed funding round. The investment will support the commercialization of its innovative HVAC technology aimed at significantly reducing energy consumption.

research_insight_text_link.research_insight_description: Evercloak is focused on the development of advanced filtration systems using graphene oxide (GO) composite membranes. Their research includes creating a dense, crosslinked network of GO sheets interleaved with aldehyde-modified cellulose nanomaterials, enhancing permeability and selectivity for molecules like water. Additionally, they are innovating methods to form GO films on substrates, optimizing the deposition process of GO ink to achieve uniform films. These advancements suggest a commitment to refining nanomaterial film technologies for improved filtration applications.

overview_description.description: Evercloak is a manufacturer of ultra-thin graphene and other 2-d nanomaterial films designed for cleantech applications. The company's platform uses a low-cost advanced manufacturing platform which builds ultra-thin nanomaterial membranes, enabling disruptive clean technologies to reduce cost, energy use and associated greenhouse gas emissions throughout the oil and gas, nuclear, energy, mining and agri-food sectors.

properties.growth_insight_description: Evercloak may be growing as it has successfully raised $2 million in seed funding, which is a significant financial milestone for startups and often used to fuel further development and growth. This influx of capital indicates investor confidence and can enable the company to expand its operations, invest in research and development, or increase its workforce. The funding is specifically aimed at reducing the energy demands of air conditioning, suggesting that Evercloak is actively working on innovative solutions within the cleantech sector.

about_short_description.short_description: Evercloak is a cleantech startup that specializes in manufacturing ultra-thin graphene and other 2D nanomaterial films.

product.name: Graphene Oxide Composite Membranes
product.description: Custom graphene oxide composite membranes designed for superior water vapor permeance and tunable performance for applications like dehumidification and evaporative cooling.

product.name: Roll-to-Roll Coating Process
product.description: A manufacturing process for large area, low-cost, high-performance nanocoatings, adaptable for various materials including graphene oxide and carbon nanotubes.

product.name: Membrane Partnership Sampling Program
product.description: A program offering access to Evercloak's graphene oxide membranes for collaborative development in HVAC, clean energy, and hydrogen technologies.

product.name: Dehumidification Membrane Technology
product.description: Innovative membrane technology for energy-efficient air dehumidification, aiming to reduce energy requirements for air conditioning systems.
